content: this legal case involves a dispute between two parties over a piece of real estate the court has determined that the property cannot be divided and has granted exclusive ownership to the plaintiffs upon payment of a sum of money additionally the plaintiffs are entitled to a portion of a postal deposit book while the defendant must return a sum of money from a bearer certificate deposit the court proceedings began in 1998 when the plaintiffs filed a writ summons the plaintiffs claimed that the defendants father had loaned them money but the defendant argued that the loan was larger and that the plaintiffs owed them money the court also considered other assets and expenses related to the inheritance it concluded that the plaintiffs should pay the defendant for their share of the property and that further investigation is needed to determine the division of other assets and debts among the parties the case has been remanded for further investigation
